body_html:
We are also seeing slowness an order of magnitude worse what's expected, and I tried to isolate the problem in a simple benchmark: https://gist.github.com/yaroslavvb/1124bb02a9fd4abce3d86caf2f950cb2

It launches 2 local tensorflow processes and tries to add 10MB vectors of in one process to variable stored in another one as fast as possible.

To run:

> python local_distributed_benchmark.py
....
Local rate:       6932.62 MB per second
Distributed rate: 161.63 MB per second

The rate of data tops out at 1.3 Gbps on my laptop, I wonder if it's a coincidence. Running on bigger machine doesn't give a speed increase, and CPU utilization stays under 20% . Same with latest nightly (GIT_VERSION='v0.10.0-1452-gdcba217-dirty')

@mrry

body:
We are also seeing slowness an order of magnitude worse what's expected, and I tried to isolate the problem in a simple benchmark: https://gist.github.com/yaroslavvb/1124bb02a9fd4abce3d86caf2f950cb2

It launches 2 local tensorflow processes and tries to add 10MB vectors of in one process to variable stored in another one as fast as possible.

To run:

```
> python local_distributed_benchmark.py
....
Local rate:       6932.62 MB per second
Distributed rate: 161.63 MB per second
```

The rate of data tops out at 1.3 Gbps on my laptop, I wonder if it's a coincidence. Running on bigger machine doesn't give a speed increase, and CPU utilization stays under 20% . Same with latest nightly (GIT_VERSION='v0.10.0-1452-gdcba217-dirty')

@mrry
